Description: Round and roughly flat disc made of brownish clay, used as strainer, slightly fired with a red slip on the upper side. The upper side is convex and shows 5 holes pierced through the object from both sides with the end parts on the upper surface widened. The underside shows remains of clay that has been pushed out of the holes as well, not further cut of or smoothed. The diameter varies from 0.5 cm in the inner part to 1.2 cm in the widened parts. The lateral side is tapering inwards towards the underside.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
